name: Carcassonne
description: Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera.
basicRules: On your turn, you draw a land tile and place it adjacent to a tile that is already on the table.
After placing a tile, you can choose to place one of your 'meeples' (followers) on it. You can place a meeple on a city, a road, a cloister, or a field.
When a city, road, or cloister is completed, the meeple on it scores points for its owner and is returned to the player's supply.
The game ends when the last tile has been placed. At the end of the game, meeples on incomplete features and in fields score points.
The player with the most points wins the game.
tips: Think carefully about where you place your tiles and your meeples.
You can try to share in other players' features to get points.
Don't forget about farmers, they can be worth a lot of points at the end of the game.
